message:
The Iranian Foreign Ministry on the resignation of Gantz from the government:
The repeated resignations in the government of the Zionist entity indicate its (the Zionist entity's -AA) collapse from within.
event_breakdown:
Gantz Resigns as Israeli Justice Minister

Israeli Justice Minister Benny Gantz announced his resignation on Friday, citing his differences with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu over the state budget and social policy.

Gantz, the leader of the centrist Blue and White party, said his decision comes amid "lack of progress in negotiations" with Netanyahu on key issues.

Gantz will continue to be the defense minister, a position he has held since Israel's unity government was formed last April.

He said that after the upcoming elections on March 23, he will continue his efforts to "change Israeli politics."

message:
Lebanon: the power of consciousness

At 01:50 in the morning, a resident of the village in the areas of southern Lebanon (Tyre district) received a WhatsApp message (from a number belonging to a Palestinian cellular network -AA) instructing him to immediately evacuate a 4-story building near the gas station in the village, because there was going to be an explosion there.

The industrious resident began to act. The residents evacuated. All the schools in the village were closed (private and public) and all this despite the fact that the end of the year exams were supposed to be held there this morning....

In the end, nothing exploded... Maybe someone needed more time to study and had a Palestinian SIM card...

This case testifies to the power of the tool called "evacuation notice". A power that increased during the last months of the war, as I wrote here a few days ago.
event_breakdown: Evacuation notice

message:

event_breakdown:
Target event:
Gantz's party rejects Palestinian statehood
Gantz's party rejects Palestinian statehood
Israel's Blue and White party has rejected the idea of a Palestinian state, breaking away from its leader's position.
Gantz's party, led by Defense Minister Benny Gantz, said in a statement on Thursday that it opposed the pursuit of a Palestinian state.
"[We] oppose the idea of establishing a Palestinian state and withdrawing to 1967 borders," the party wrote in a Hebrew-language statement, adding that the party believed "the State of Israel is the national state of the Jewish people".
Gantz's remarks come after Israeli Prime Minister Naftali Bennett and Foreign Minister Yair Lapid said earlier this week that they did not back a Palestinian state, aligning themselves more closely with the positions of their right-wing coalition partners.
But Aaron David Miller, a Middle East analyst at the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace, said Gantz's position "reflects a fundamental shift on the Israeli right".
"It's a huge departure from the Palestinian state situation. While there is no prospect of a Palestinian state at this moment ... by saying 'no and no', this is a rejection of the '67 borders and the new peace initiatives," said Miller.
"The Israelis were the ones who said, 'No, no, no, the Palestinians will never recognize Israel as a Jewish state'. Well, now the Israelis are rejecting the initiative of a Palestinian state. I think it's going to have huge political implications within Israel."
Miller added that while Gantz's position puts pressure on US President Joe Biden's pursuit of a two-state solution to the Israeli-Palestinian

event_breakdown:
The South China Sea dispute is an ongoing territorial dispute between China and several other East Asian countries. It involves control of the Scarborough Shoal, Second Thomas Shoal and the Spratly Islands. A naval confrontation occurred on 12 April 2012 when Philippine authorities attempted to capture the crew of a Chinese fishing vessel. This is an ongoing dispute.
The Gaza-Israel Border Conflict is an ongoing conflict between Israel and Palestinian militants in Gaza. It began in March 2018, when Palestinian protesters clashed with Israeli security forces at the border between Gaza and Israel. There have been several outbreaks of violence since then, with both sides blaming each other for the escalation.
The Israeli-Palestinian Conflict is an ongoing conflict between Israel and the Palestinian National Authority (PA), which claims the right to rule the West Bank and Gaza. The conflict has lasted for several decades, with both sides blaming each other for the escalation.
The United States-China Trade War is an ongoing trade dispute between the United States and China. It began in 2018, when the United States imposed tariffs on Chinese goods in response to China's trade practices. Since then, the two countries have engaged in a series of negotiations to reach an agreement on trade.
The Russia-Ukraine Conflict is a conflict between Russia and Ukraine. It began in 2014, when Russia annexed the Crimean Peninsula from Ukraine. Since then, the two countries have been in a state of war, with both sides blaming each other for the escalation.
The North Korea-South Korea Conflict is an ongoing conflict between North Korea and South Korea. It began in 1950, when North Korea invaded South Korea. Since then, the two countries have been in a state of war, with both sides blaming each other for the escalation.

message: Additional documentation of the fall of the Israeli drone in the skies of Rihan in southern Lebanon.
location: The Israeli drone was allegedly downed by Hezbollah operatives in Rihan, southern Lebanon. The exact coordinates
event_breakdown: The Israeli army confirmed on Sunday that a drone had fallen in Lebanese territory during a routine operation along the border. The Israeli military confirmed that the drone was not an armed drone and said it was investigating the incident. The drone is said to have crashed in southern Lebanon. "The issue is being examined," the military said in a statement, adding that it had contacted UN peacekeepers operating in southern Lebanon and was seeking information about the drone's location. The Israeli army said in a statement that the drone had fallen into Shebaa Farms, a disputed territory controlled by Israel that is also claimed by Lebanon and Syria. Israeli military officials do not claim to have been violating Lebanese airspace.

message:
Palestinians rallying against the United Arab Emirates because of "Cafe Bibi"

Palestinians on social media are accusing the United Arab Emirates of treason after watching a video that was published in the last day and was filmed in Dubai at a place called "Cafe Bibi".

The videographer notes that the place is called "Cafe Bibi" in light of Netanyahu's efforts to promote normalization with the United Arab Emirates and the Abraham Accords, according to the owner of the place.

Against the background of the war in Gaza, the level of cursing on the part of the Palestinians is higher than usual...

The place is kosher according to the person filming...
event_breakdown:
Cafe Bibi, located in Dubai, United Arab Emirates, is the subject of controversy and protests by Palestinians on social media. Palestinians are accusing the UAE of treason after a video was released showing a kosher restaurant with the name "Cafe Bibi", which promotes the normalization of relations between the UAE and Israel.

This video has become a controversial topic since protests against UAE's normalization with Israel had been going on since the latest Gaza war. Even though thousands of Arabs cheered for the UAE when they established diplomatic ties with Israel last year, Syrians surprised the world by publicly protesting against this normalization. Therefore, Palestinians started to express their discontent through social media by releasing a video that shows the Café Bibi.

The owner of this restaurant, with the location of Dubai, noted that the name of this café is a reference to Netanyahu's efforts to establish a friendly relationship between UAE and Israel, but it cannot be considered treason yet, because UAE and Israel have already established diplomatic ties. Moreover, the Café Bibi, and the Kosher dietary requirements are offensive to Palestinians, and the point of this protest was to condemn the UAE-Israel friendship and support for the people of Palestine and to stop this normalization process.

In conclusion, it seems that the UAE-Israel friendship is kind of overwhelming for anyone around the world, because of UAE's strategic advantages with Israel. Thus, according to the videographer, this restaurant kosher which will be boycotted according to the public's reaction.

event_breakdown:
The target event - a news push that reports an event that is happening in the current time frame, belongs to to the category security, and that has an exact known location, and was first reported on 2022-01-23
Gaza militants fire 2 rockets toward southern Israel
Palestinian militants in the Gaza Strip fired two rockets toward southern Israel on Thursday evening, setting off air raid sirens in the area, the Israeli military said.

The Israel Defense Forces said the rockets were intercepted by its Iron Dome missile defense system. There was no immediate word of casualties or damage.

The rockets were fired from near the Palestinian town of Rafah. Israel holds Gaza's Hamas rulers responsible for any fire from the coastal territory. Recent months have seen an increase in such incidents, raising fears of an escalation in the conflict.

Gaza's ruling Hamas militant group did not claim responsibility for the overnight salvo which was the first since December 2020.

Israel and Hamas, a group sworn to Israel's destruction, are bitter enemies that have fought three wars and numerous skirmishes since Hamas seized control of Gaza in 2007.

The escalation comes at a time of political limbo in Israel, which is still holding a planned March 23 election.

Defence Minister Benny Gantz and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu chairing separate meetings of their ruling Kahol Lavan and Blue and White parties, saying that Israel would not allow itself to be "dragged" into a conflict with Hamas.

Gantz, a centrist, made his remarks before Netanyahu's more hawkish Likud party voted with the opposition to dissolve the parliament
